00046 #define OFD_INIT_OBJID  0
00047 #define OFD_PRECREATE_BATCH_DEFAULT (OBJ_SUBDIR_COUNT * 4)
00048 
00049 /* on small filesystems we should not precreate too many objects in
00050  * a single transaction, otherwise we can overflow transactions */
00051 #define OFD_PRECREATE_SMALL_FS          (1024ULL * 1024 * 1024)
00052 #define OFD_PRECREATE_BATCH_SMALL       8
00053 
00054 /* Limit the returned fields marked valid to those that we actually might set */
00055 #define OFD_VALID_FLAGS (LA_TYPE | LA_MODE | LA_SIZE | LA_BLOCKS | \
00056                          LA_BLKSIZE | LA_ATIME | LA_MTIME | LA_CTIME)
00057 
00058 /* per-client-per-object persistent state (LRU) */
00059 struct ofd_mod_data {
00060         struct list_head fmd_list;        /* linked to fed_mod_list */
00061         struct lu_fid    fmd_fid;         /* FID being written to */
00062         __u64            fmd_mactime_xid; /* xid highest {m,a,c}time setattr */
00063         cfs_time_t       fmd_expire;      /* time when the fmd should expire */
00064         int              fmd_refcount;    /* reference counter - list holds 1 */
00065 };
00066 
00067 #define OFD_FMD_MAX_NUM_DEFAULT 128
00068 #define OFD_FMD_MAX_AGE_DEFAULT msecs_to_jiffies((obd_timeout+10)*MSEC_PER_SEC)
00069 
00070 #define OFD_SOFT_SYNC_LIMIT_DEFAULT 16

00072 /* request stats */
00073 enum {
00074         LPROC_OFD_STATS_READ = 0,
00075         LPROC_OFD_STATS_WRITE,
00076         LPROC_OFD_STATS_GETATTR,
00077         LPROC_OFD_STATS_SETATTR,
00078         LPROC_OFD_STATS_PUNCH,
00079         LPROC_OFD_STATS_SYNC,
00080         LPROC_OFD_STATS_DESTROY,
00081         LPROC_OFD_STATS_CREATE,
00082         LPROC_OFD_STATS_STATFS,
00083         LPROC_OFD_STATS_GET_INFO,
00084         LPROC_OFD_STATS_SET_INFO,
00085         LPROC_OFD_STATS_QUOTACTL,
00086         LPROC_OFD_STATS_LAST,
00087 };

00089 static inline void ofd_counter_incr(struct obd_export *exp, int opcode,
00090                                     char *jobid, long amount)
00091 {
00092         if (exp->exp_obd && exp->exp_obd->obd_stats)
00093                 lprocfs_counter_add(exp->exp_obd->obd_stats, opcode, amount);
00094 
00095         if (exp->exp_obd && exp->exp_obd->u.obt.obt_jobstats.ojs_hash &&
00096             (exp_connect_flags(exp) & OBD_CONNECT_JOBSTATS))
00097                 lprocfs_job_stats_log(exp->exp_obd, jobid, opcode, amount);
00098 
00099         if (exp->exp_nid_stats != NULL &&
00100             exp->exp_nid_stats->nid_stats != NULL) {
00101                 lprocfs_counter_add(exp->exp_nid_stats->nid_stats, opcode,
00102                                     amount);
00103         }
00104 }

00106 struct ofd_seq {
00107         struct list_head        os_list;
00108         struct ost_id           os_oi;
00109         spinlock_t              os_last_oid_lock;
00110         struct mutex            os_create_lock;
00111         atomic_t                os_refc;
00112         struct dt_object        *os_lastid_obj;
00113         unsigned long           os_destroys_in_progress:1;
00114 };

00116 struct ofd_device {
00117         struct dt_device         ofd_dt_dev;
00118         struct dt_device        *ofd_osd;
00119         struct obd_export       *ofd_osd_exp;
00120         struct dt_device_param   ofd_dt_conf;
00121         /* DLM name-space for meta-data locks maintained by this server */
00122         struct ldlm_namespace   *ofd_namespace;
00123 
00124         /* last_rcvd file */
00125         struct lu_target         ofd_lut;
00126         struct dt_object        *ofd_health_check_file;
00127 
00128         int                      ofd_subdir_count;
00129         __u64                    ofd_inconsistency_self_detected;
00130         __u64                    ofd_inconsistency_self_repaired;
00131 
00132         struct list_head        ofd_seq_list;
00133         rwlock_t                ofd_seq_list_lock;
00134         int                     ofd_seq_count;
00135         int                     ofd_precreate_batch;
00136         spinlock_t              ofd_batch_lock;
00137 
00138         /* protect all statfs-related counters */
00139         spinlock_t               ofd_osfs_lock;
00140         /* statfs optimization: we cache a bit  */
00141         struct obd_statfs        ofd_osfs;
00142         __u64                    ofd_osfs_age;
00143         int                      ofd_blockbits;
00144         /* writes between prep & commit which might be accounted twice in
00145          * ofd_osfs.os_bavail */
00146         u64                      ofd_osfs_unstable;
00147 
00148         /* counters used during statfs update, protected by ofd_osfs_lock.
00149          * record when some statfs refresh are in progress */
00150         int                      ofd_statfs_inflight;
00151         /* track writes completed while statfs refresh is underway.
00152          * tracking is only effective when ofd_statfs_inflight > 1 */
00153         u64                      ofd_osfs_inflight;
00154 
00155         /* grants: all values in bytes */
00156         /* grant lock to protect all grant counters */
00157         spinlock_t               ofd_grant_lock;
00158         /* total amount of dirty data reported by clients in incoming obdo */
00159         u64                      ofd_tot_dirty;
00160         /* sum of filesystem space granted to clients for async writes */
00161         u64                      ofd_tot_granted;
00162         /* grant used by I/Os in progress (between prepare and commit) */
00163         u64                      ofd_tot_pending;
00164         /* number of clients using grants */
00165         int                      ofd_tot_granted_clients;
00166 
00167         /* preferred BRW size, decided by storage type and capability */
00168         __u32                    ofd_brw_size;
00169 
00170         /* ofd mod data: ofd_device wide values */
00171         int                      ofd_fmd_max_num; /* per ofd ofd_mod_data */
00172         cfs_duration_t           ofd_fmd_max_age; /* time to fmd expiry */
00173 
00174         spinlock_t               ofd_flags_lock;
00175         unsigned long            ofd_raid_degraded:1,
00176                                  /* sync journal on writes */
00177                                  ofd_syncjournal:1,
00178                                  /* shall we grant space to clients not
00179                                   * supporting OBD_CONNECT_GRANT_PARAM? */
00180                                  ofd_grant_compat_disable:1,
00181                                  /* Protected by ofd_lastid_rwsem. */
00182                                  ofd_lastid_rebuilding:1,
00183                                  ofd_record_fid_accessed:1,
00184                                  ofd_lfsck_verify_pfid:1,
00185                                  ofd_skip_lfsck:1;
00186         struct seq_server_site   ofd_seq_site;
00187         /* the limit of SOFT_SYNC RPCs that will trigger a soft sync */
00188         unsigned int             ofd_soft_sync_limit;
00189         /* Protect ::ofd_lastid_rebuilding */
00190         struct rw_semaphore      ofd_lastid_rwsem;
00191         __u64                    ofd_lastid_gen;
00192         struct ptlrpc_thread     ofd_inconsistency_thread;
00193         struct list_head         ofd_inconsistency_list;
00194         spinlock_t               ofd_inconsistency_lock;
00195 };

00197 static inline struct ofd_device *ofd_dev(struct lu_device *d)
00198 {
00199         return container_of0(d, struct ofd_device, ofd_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev);
00200 }
00201 
00202 static inline struct obd_device *ofd_obd(struct ofd_device *ofd)
00203 {
00204         return ofd->ofd_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev.ld_obd;
00205 }
00206 
00207 static inline struct ofd_device *ofd_exp(struct obd_export *exp)
00208 {
00209         return ofd_dev(exp->exp_obd->obd_lu_dev);
00210 }
00211 
00212 static inline char *ofd_name(struct ofd_device *ofd)
00213 {
00214         return ofd->ofd_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev.ld_obd->obd_name;
00215 }

00217 struct ofd_object {
00218         struct lu_object_header ofo_header;
00219         struct dt_object        ofo_obj;
00220         struct lu_fid           ofo_pfid;
00221         unsigned int            ofo_pfid_checking:1,
00222                                 ofo_pfid_verified:1;
00223 };
00224 
00225 static inline struct ofd_object *ofd_obj(struct lu_object *o)
00226 {
00227         return container_of0(o, struct ofd_object, ofo_obj.do_lu);
00228 }
00229 
00230 static inline int ofd_object_exists(struct ofd_object *obj)
00231 {
00232         LASSERT(obj != NULL);
00233         if (lu_object_is_dying(obj->ofo_obj.do_lu.lo_header))
00234                 return 0;
00235         return lu_object_exists(&obj->ofo_obj.do_lu);
00236 }
00237 
00238 static inline struct dt_object *fo2dt(struct ofd_object *obj)
00239 {
00240         return &obj->ofo_obj;
00241 }
00242 
00243 static inline struct dt_object *ofd_object_child(struct ofd_object *_obj)
00244 {
00245         struct lu_object *lu = &(_obj)->ofo_obj.do_lu;
00246 
00247         return container_of0(lu_object_next(lu), struct dt_object, do_lu);
00248 }
00249 
00250 static inline struct ofd_device *ofd_obj2dev(const struct ofd_object *fo)
00251 {
00252         return ofd_dev(fo->ofo_obj.do_lu.lo_dev);
00253 }
00254 
00255 static inline void ofd_read_lock(const struct lu_env *env,
00256                                  struct ofd_object *fo)
00257 {
00258         struct dt_object  *next = ofd_object_child(fo);
00259 
00260         next->do_ops->do_read_lock(env, next, 0);
00261 }
00262 
00263 static inline void ofd_read_unlock(const struct lu_env *env,
00264                                    struct ofd_object *fo)
00265 {
00266         struct dt_object  *next = ofd_object_child(fo);
00267 
00268         next->do_ops->do_read_unlock(env, next);
00269 }
00270 
00271 static inline void ofd_write_lock(const struct lu_env *env,
00272                                   struct ofd_object *fo)
00273 {
00274         struct dt_object *next = ofd_object_child(fo);
00275 
00276         next->do_ops->do_write_lock(env, next, 0);
00277 }
00278 
00279 static inline void ofd_write_unlock(const struct lu_env *env,
00280                                     struct ofd_object *fo)
00281 {
00282         struct dt_object  *next = ofd_object_child(fo);
00283 
00284         next->do_ops->do_write_unlock(env, next);
00285 }

00287 /*
00288  * Common data shared by obdofd-level handlers. This is allocated per-thread
00289  * to reduce stack consumption.
00290  */
00291 struct ofd_thread_info {
00292         const struct lu_env             *fti_env;
00293 
00294         struct obd_export               *fti_exp;
00295         __u64                            fti_xid;
00296         __u64                            fti_pre_version;
00297 
00298         struct lu_fid                    fti_fid;
00299         struct lu_attr                   fti_attr;
00300         struct lu_attr                   fti_attr2;
00301         struct ldlm_res_id               fti_resid;
00302         union {
00303                 struct filter_fid        fti_mds_fid;
00304                 struct filter_fid_old    fti_mds_fid_old;
00305         };
00306         struct ost_id                    fti_ostid;
00307         struct ofd_object               *fti_obj;
00308         union {
00309                 char                     name[64]; /* for ofd_init0() */
00310                 struct obd_statfs        osfs;    /* for obdofd_statfs() */
00311         } fti_u;
00312 
00313         /* Ops object filename */
00314         struct lu_name                   fti_name;
00315         struct dt_object_format          fti_dof;
00316         struct lu_buf                    fti_buf;
00317         loff_t                           fti_off;
00318 
00319         /* Space used by the I/O, used by grant code */
00320         unsigned long                    fti_used;
00321         struct ost_lvb                   fti_lvb;
00322         union {
00323                 struct lfsck_request     fti_lr;
00324                 struct obd_connect_data  fti_ocd;
00325         };
00326 };

00419 static inline
00420 struct ofd_object *ofd_object_find_exists(const struct lu_env *env,
00421                                           struct ofd_device *ofd,
00422                                           const struct lu_fid *fid)
00423 {
00424         struct ofd_object *fo;
00425 
00426         fo = ofd_object_find(env, ofd, fid);
00427         if (!IS_ERR(fo) && !ofd_object_exists(fo)) {
00428                 ofd_object_put(env, fo);
00429                 fo = ERR_PTR(-ENOENT);
00430         }
00431         return fo;
00432 }
00433 
00434 /* ofd_grants.c */
00435 static inline int ofd_grant_param_supp(struct obd_export *exp)
00436 {
00437         return !!(exp_connect_flags(exp) & OBD_CONNECT_GRANT_PARAM);
00438 }
00439 
00440 /* Blocksize used for client not supporting OBD_CONNECT_GRANT_PARAM.
00441  * That's 4KB=2^12 which is the biggest block size known to work whatever
00442  * the client's page size is. */
00443 #define COMPAT_BSIZE_SHIFT 12
00444 
00445 static inline int ofd_grant_prohibit(struct obd_export *exp,
00446                                      struct ofd_device *ofd)
00447 {
00448         /* When ofd_grant_compat_disable is set, we don't grant any space to
00449          * clients not supporting OBD_CONNECT_GRANT_PARAM.
00450          * Otherwise, space granted to such a client is inflated since it
00451          * consumes PAGE_CACHE_SIZE of grant space per block */
00452         return !!(ofd_obd(ofd)->obd_self_export != exp &&
00453                   !ofd_grant_param_supp(exp) && ofd->ofd_grant_compat_disable);
00454 }
00455

00464                              int niocount);

00501 static inline struct ofd_thread_info *ofd_info(const struct lu_env *env)
00502 {
00503         struct ofd_thread_info *info;
00504 
00505         lu_env_refill((void *)env);
00506         info = lu_context_key_get(&env->le_ctx, &ofd_thread_key);
00507         LASSERT(info);
00508         return info;
00509 }
00510 
00511 static inline struct ofd_thread_info *ofd_info_init(const struct lu_env *env,
00512                                                     struct obd_export *exp)
00513 {
00514         struct ofd_thread_info *info;
00515 
00516         info = ofd_info(env);
00517         LASSERT(info->fti_exp == NULL);
00518         LASSERT(info->fti_env == NULL);
00519         LASSERT(info->fti_attr.la_valid == 0);
00520 
00521         info->fti_env = env;
00522         info->fti_exp = exp;
00523         info->fti_pre_version = 0;
00524         return info;
00525 }
00526 
00527 static inline struct ofd_thread_info *tsi2ofd_info(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00528 {
00529         struct ptlrpc_request   *req = tgt_ses_req(tsi);
00530         struct ofd_thread_info  *info;
00531 
00532         info = ofd_info(tsi->tsi_env);
00533         LASSERT(info->fti_exp == NULL);
00534         LASSERT(info->fti_env == NULL);
00535         LASSERT(info->fti_attr.la_valid == 0);
00536 
00537         info->fti_env = tsi->tsi_env;
00538         info->fti_exp = tsi->tsi_exp;
00539 
00540         info->fti_xid = req->rq_xid;
00542         if (req->rq_reqmsg != NULL &&
00543             lustre_msg_get_flags(req->rq_reqmsg) & MSG_REPLAY) {
00544                 __u64 *pre_version = lustre_msg_get_versions(req->rq_reqmsg);
00545 
00546                 info->fti_pre_version = pre_version ? pre_version[0] : 0;
00547         }
00548         return info;
00549 }
00550 
00551 /* sync on lock cancel is useless when we force a journal flush,
00552  * and if we enable async journal commit, we should also turn on
00553  * sync on lock cancel if it is not enabled already. */
00554 static inline void ofd_slc_set(struct ofd_device *ofd)
00555 {
00556         if (ofd->ofd_syncjournal == 1)
00557                 ofd->ofd_lut.lut_sync_lock_cancel = NEVER_SYNC_ON_CANCEL;
00558         else if (ofd->ofd_lut.lut_sync_lock_cancel == NEVER_SYNC_ON_CANCEL)
00559                 ofd->ofd_lut.lut_sync_lock_cancel = ALWAYS_SYNC_ON_CANCEL;
00560 }
00561 
00562 static inline void ofd_prepare_fidea(struct filter_fid *ff,
00563                                      const struct obdo *oa)
00564 {
00565         /* packing fid and converting it to LE for storing into EA.
00566          * Here ->o_stripe_idx should be filled by LOV and rest of
00567          * fields - by client. */
00568         ff->ff_parent.f_seq = cpu_to_le64(oa->o_parent_seq);
00569         ff->ff_parent.f_oid = cpu_to_le32(oa->o_parent_oid);
00570         /* XXX: we are ignoring o_parent_ver here, since this should
00571          *      be the same for all objects in this fileset. */
00572         ff->ff_parent.f_ver = cpu_to_le32(oa->o_stripe_idx);
00573 }
